intro: Centaurea campylacme, commonly known as the bent-capselle centaury, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has a compact, upright growth habit. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, while its flowers range in color from pale yellow to reddish-brown. Centaurea campylacme is often found in open grasslands and along coastal areas, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
